str2: A multitude, crowd, great number, assemblage. From pletho; a fulness, i.e. A large number, throng, populace.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From sun and erchomai; to convene, depart in company with, associate with, or, cohabit.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A city, the inhabitants of a city. Probably from the same as polemos, or perhaps from polus; a town.
Round about, neighboring. Adverb from peri; all around, i.e. circumjacent.
Of Hebrew origin; Hierusalem, the capitol of Palestine.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To carry, bear, bring; I conduct, lead; perhaps: I make publicly known. A primary verb.
(lit: not strong), (a) weak (physically, or morally), (b) infirm, sick. Strengthless.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Masculine Plural
str2: To trouble, torment, worry, vex. From ochlos; to mob, i.e. to harass.
A primary preposition; under, i.e. of place, or with verbs; of place (underneath) or where (below) or time (when).

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Plural

str2: All, the whole, altogether. Absolutely all or every one.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From the same as therapon; to wait upon menially, i.e. to adore, or to relieve.
